You are given $n$ glasses arranged in a row, numbered from 1 to $n$. A marble is placed under a glass at position $s$.  You can perform shuffling operations, where each operation moves each glass to a new position according to a given set of rules.  

For example, if the rules are $p_1$, $p_2$, ..., $p_n$, then glass 1 moves to position $p_1$, glass 2 moves to position $p_2$, and so on.

After performing some number of shuffling operations (possibly zero), the marble ends up under a glass at position $t$.  

Your task is to determine the minimum number of shuffling operations required to move the marble from position $s$ to position $t$. If it is impossible to move the marble from $s$ to $t$ with any number of shuffles, output -1.
